input_text:
Job Title: Construction Superintendent

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Project Management

Description:
Title: Construction SuperintendentSalary: $105,000 to $135,000 (Additional option for a $600 car allowance OR a company vehicle with company gas card and maintenance expensed).Location: Houston, TXSchedule: M-F, 8am-5pm, FULLY ONSITE. *May be asked to work weekends in order to complete objectives critical to maintain project timeline).
Job Description:Insight Global is looking for a Construction Superintendent to join one of our construction clients in Houston, TX. You will oversee self-performed and contracted work ensuring compliance with contract documents and the project schedule while also implementing a culture of safety and quality. ResponsibilitiesOversee the timely and quality installation of contracted work of either a total project or a particular scope, trade contractor, or portion of a project.Implement a culture of safety and quality among employees and trade contractors and conduct regular safety inspections to ensure all work conditions are in compliance with company, contract, and government regulations. Create and manage a plan to successfully sequence work, manage jobsite logistics, and track materials and personnel.Ensure a high quality of work consistent with project and company standards.Takes initiative and personal responsibility to deliver a project on schedule and on budget.Develop, update, and communicate the project schedule and exhibit a command of critical schedule milestones with all project stakeholders.Manage, mentor, and develop team members to build a high functioning team.Cultivate strong relationships with all project stakeholders.Maintain professionalism while representing the company and team in internal and external meetings and interactions. Possess working knowledge of the owner contract, subcontracts, and vendor agreements.Participate in the development and maintenance of staff charts, general conditions, project costs, and demonstrate an understanding of key performance indicators (KPI) for the project.Participate in close-out activities including punch list and building operations training.Demonstrate advanced problem-solving capabilities in finding ways to overcome constant obstacles, issues, and conflicts on the job.  Minimum Requirements:- Undergraduate degree in engineering, architecture, construction management, or a related discipline.- 7 years of large-scale commercial construction projects with at least 2 years in a supervisory/management role.- Previous experience with at least 1 airport terminal project (remodel or new construction) for the entire lifecycle.- Proficient knowledge of construction management software including Procore, FieldWire, Bluebeam, and P6. Preferred Requirements:- Additional previous experience working on hospital, higher education, or sports facility projects.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Implement a culture of safety and quality

Represent the company and team in meetings

benefits: Additional option for a $600 car allowance
Company vehicle with company gas card and maintenance expenses

- Undergraduate degree in engineering, architecture, construction management, or a related discipline.
- 7 years of large-scale commercial construction projects with at least 2 years in a supervisory/management role.
- Previous experience with at least 1 airport terminal project (remodel or new construction) for the entire lifecycle.
- Proficient knowledge of construction management software including Procore, FieldWire, Bluebeam, and P6.
